name: Human-Animal Relationships
descriptions: The Human-Animal Relationships minor gives insights into the crucial, diverse, and often overlooked aspects animals contribute daily to our society, economy, culture, and well-being. Courses are drawn from over a dozen programs including anthropology, art, biology, English, environmental science, and psychology.
The program develops skills in empathy and perspective-taking applicable to diverse fields including veterinary medicine, social work, wildlife management, law, and criminal justice.

courses: HARE/ANTH/SOCI 30403 - Perspectives on Human-Animal Relationships - 3 hrs.

electiveCourses.description: Five electives from the approved course list. No more than 6 hours of electives from the same discipline. Other courses may qualify with permission from the minor director.

features: Courses from 12+ programs including anthropology, art, biology, English, and psychology
Student organizations: People for Animal Well-Being (PAW), TCU Service Dog Organization, TCU Wildlife Society
